text: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the chosen who are residing temporarily in the dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,
speaker: Narrator

text: according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, by the sanctification of the Spirit, for obedience and for sprinkling with the blood of Jesus Christ. May grace and peace be multiplied to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to his great mercy has caused us to be born again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
speaker: Narrator

text: into an inheritance imperishable and undefiled and unfading, reserved in heaven for you
speaker: Narrator

text: who are being protected by the power of God through faith for a salvation ready to be revealed in the last time,
speaker: Narrator

text: in which you rejoice greatly, although now for a short time, if necessary, you are distressed by various trials,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that the genuineness of your faith, more valuable than gold that is passing away, but is tested by fire, may be found to result in praise and glory and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: whom, although you have not seen, you love; in whom now you believe, although you do not see him, and you rejoice greatly with joy inexpressible and full of glory,
speaker: Narrator

text: obtaining the goal of your faith, the salvation of your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning this salvation, the prophets who prophesied about the grace meant for you sought and made careful inquiry,
speaker: Narrator

text: investigating for what person or which time the Spirit of Christ in them was indicating when he testified beforehand to the sufferings with reference to Christ and the glories after these things,
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom it was revealed that they were serving not themselves but you with reference to the same things which now have been announced to you through those who proclaimed the gospel to you by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven, things into which angels desire to look.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, when you have prepared your minds for action by being self-controlled, put your hope completely in the grace that will be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: As obedient children, do not be conformed to the former desires you used to conform to in your ignorance,
speaker: Narrator

text: but as the one who called you is holy, you yourselves be holy in all your conduct,
speaker: Narrator

text: for it is written, “You will be holy, because I am holy.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And if you call on him as Father who judges impartially according to each one’s work, conduct yourselves with fear during the time of your temporary residence,
speaker: Narrator

text: because you know that you were redeemed from your futile way of life inherited from your ancestors not with perishable things like silver or gold,
speaker: Narrator

text: but with the precious blood of Christ, like that of an unblemished and spotless lamb
speaker: Narrator

text: who was foreknown before the foundation of the world, but has been revealed in these last times for you
speaker: Narrator

text: who through him are believing in God, who raised him from the dead and gave him glory, so that your faith and hope are in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Having purified your souls by your obedience to the truth for sincere brotherly love, love one another fervently from the heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: because you have been born again, not from perishable seed but imperishable, through the living and enduring word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For
“all flesh is like grass,
    and all its glory like the flower of the grass.
The grass withers and the flower falls off,
speaker: Narrator

text:
but the word of the Lord endures forever.”
And this is the word that has been proclaimed to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, ridding yourselves of all malice and all deceit and hypocrisy and envy and all slander,
speaker: Narrator

text: like newborn infants long for the unadulterated spiritual milk, so that by it you may grow up to salvation,
speaker: Narrator

text: if you have tasted that the Lord is kind,
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom you are drawing near, a living stone rejected by men but chosen and precious in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you yourselves, as living stones, are being built up as a spiritual house for a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For it stands in scripture,
“Behold, I am laying in Zion a stone, a chosen and precious cornerstone,
and the one who believes in him will never be put to shame.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the honor is for you who believe, but for those who refuse to believe,
“The stone that the builders rejected,
this one has become the cornerstone,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
and
“A stone of stumbling and a rock of offense,”
who stumble because they disobey the word to which also they were consigned.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s possession, so that you may proclaim the virtues of the one who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light,
speaker: Narrator

text: who once were not a people, but now are the people of God, the ones who were not shown mercy, but now are shown mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dear friends, I urge you as foreigners and temporary residents to abstain from fleshly desires which wage war against your soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: maintaining your good conduct among the Gentiles, so that in the things in which they slander you as evildoers, by seeing your good deeds they may glorify God on the day of visitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Subject yourselves to every human authority for the sake of the Lord, whether to a king as having supreme authority,
speaker: Narrator

text: or to governors as those sent out by him for the punishment of those who do evil and the praise of those who do good.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the will of God is as follows: by doing good to silence the ignorance of foolish people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Live as free persons, and not using your freedom as a covering for evil, but as slaves of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor all people, love the community of believers, fear God, honor the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Domestic slaves, be subject to your masters with all respect, not only to those who are good and gentle, but also to those who are unjust.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this finds favor, if because of consciousness of God someone endures sorrows while suffering unjustly.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what credit is it if, when you sin and are beaten for it, you endure? But if you endure when you do good and suffer for it, this finds favor with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to this you were called, because Christ also suffered for you, leaving you an example, so that you should follow in his footsteps,
speaker: Narrator

text: who did not commit sin, nor was deceit found in his mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text: who when he was reviled, did not revile in return; when suffering, he did not threaten, but entrusted himself to the one who judges justly,
speaker: Narrator

text: who himself bore our sins in his body on the tree, so that we may die to sins and live to righteousness, by whose wounds you were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you were going astray like sheep, but you have turned back now to the shepherd and guardian of your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, wives, be subject to your own husbands, so that even if some are disobedient to the word, they may be won over without a word by the conduct of their wives,
speaker: Narrator

text: when they see your respectful, pure conduct.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let your adornment not be the external kind, braiding hair and putting on gold jewelry or putting on fine clothing,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the hidden person of the heart, with the imperishable quality of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is highly valuable in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in the same way formerly the holy women also, who hoped in God, used to adorn themselves by being subject to their own husbands,
speaker: Narrator

text: like Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord, whose children you have become when you do good and are not frightened with respect to any terror.
speaker: Narrator

text: Husbands, in the same way live with your wives knowledgeably, as with the weaker female vessel, showing them honor as fellow heirs also of the grace of life, so that your prayers will not be hindered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And finally, all of you be harmonious, sympathetic, showing mutual affection, compassionate, humble,
speaker: Narrator

text: not repaying evil for evil or insult for insult, but on the other hand blessing others, because for this reason you were called, so that you could inherit a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For
“The one who wants to love life
    and see good days
must keep his tongue from evil
    and his lips must not speak deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he must turn away from evil and do good;
    he must seek peace and pursue it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the eyes of the Lord are on the righteous,
    and his ears are open to their prayer.
But the face of the Lord is against those who do evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And who is the one who will harm you if you are a zealous adherent for what is good?
speaker: Narrator

text: But even if you might suffer for the sake of righteousness, you are blessed. And do not be afraid of their intimidation or be disturbed,
speaker: Narrator

text: but set Christ apart as Lord in your hearts, always ready to make a defense to anyone who asks you for an accounting concerning the hope that is in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But do so with courtesy and respect, having a good conscience, so that in the things in which you are slandered, the ones who malign your good conduct in Christ may be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is better to suffer for doing good, if God wills it, than for doing evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Christ also suffered once for sins,
    the just for the unjust,
in order that he could bring you to God,
    being put to death in the flesh,
but made alive in the spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: in which also he went and proclaimed to the spirits in prison,
speaker: Narrator

text: who were formerly disobedient, when the patience of God waited in the days of Noah, while an ark was being constructed, in which a few—that is, eight souls—were rescued through water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And also, corresponding to this, baptism now saves you, not the removal of dirt from the flesh, but an appeal to God for a good conscience through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: who is at the right hand of God, having gone into heaven, with angels and authorities and powers having been subjected to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, because Christ suffered in the flesh, you also equip yourselves with the same way of thinking, because the one who has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order to live the remaining time in the flesh no longer for human desires, but for the will of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the time that has passed was sufficient to do what the Gentiles desire to do, having lived in licentiousness, evil desires, drunkenness, carousing, drinking parties, and wanton idolatries,
speaker: Narrator

text: with respect to which they are surprised when you do not run with them into the same flood of dissipation, and so they revile you.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will give an account to the one who is ready to judge the living and the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because for this reason also the gospel was preached to those who are dead, so that they were judged by human standards in the flesh, but they may live in the spirit by God’s standards.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the end of all things draws near. Therefore be self-controlled and sober-minded for your prayers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above all, keep your love for one another constant, because love covers a large number of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be hospitable to one another without complaining.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as each one has received a gift, use it for serving one another, as good stewards of the varied grace of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone speaks, let it be as the oracles of God; if anyone serves, let it be as by the strength that God provides, so that in all things God will be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom is the glory and the power forever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dear friends, do not be surprised at the fiery ordeal among you, when it takes place to test you, as if something strange were happening to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the degree that you share in the sufferings of Christ, rejoice, so that also at the revelation of his glory you may rejoice and be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you are reviled on account of the name of Christ, you are blessed, because the Spirit of glory and of God rests on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: By all means do not let anyone of you suffer as a murderer or a thief or an evildoer or as a meddler.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if someone suffers as a Christian, he must not be ashamed, but must glorify God with this name.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is the time for the judgment to begin out from the household of God. But if it begins out from us first, what will be the outcome for those who are disobedient to the gospel of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the righteous are saved with difficulty, what will become of the ungodly and the sinner?
speaker: Narrator

text: So then also those who suffer according to the will of God must entrust their souls to a faithful Creator in doing good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I, your fellow elder and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a sharer of the glory that is going to be revealed, exhort the elders among you:
speaker: Narrator

text: shepherd the flock of God among you, exercising oversight not by compulsion but willingly, in accordance with God, and not greedily but eagerly,
speaker: Narrator

text: and not as lording it over those under your care, but being examples for the flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the chief Shepherd appears, you will receive the unfading crown of glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, younger men, be subject to the elders, and all of you clothe yourselves with humility toward one another, because God opposes the proud, but gives grace to the humble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, so that he may exalt you at the right time,
speaker: Narrator

text: casting all your cares on him, because he cares for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be sober; be on the alert. Your adversary the devil walks around like a roaring lion, looking for someone to devour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Resist him, steadfast in your faith, because you know the same kinds of sufferings are being accomplished by your community of believers in the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the God of all grace, who called you to his eternal glory in Christ, after you have suffered for a short time, will himself restore, confirm, strengthen, and establish you.
speaker: Narrator

text: To him be the power forever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through Silvanus, the faithful brother (as I consider him), I have written to you briefly to encourage you and to attest that this is the true grace of God. Stand firm in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: She who is in Babylon, chosen the same as you, greets you, and so does my son Mark.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet one another with a loving kiss. Peace to all of you who are in Christ.
speaker: Narrator
